tables.name: valsi
tables.schema: ++id, bangu, w, y, d, n, t, *s, g, *r, *cache

rows.d: $x_{1}$ utters verbally/says/phonates/speaks [vocally makes sound] $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also voices; does not necessarily imply communication or audience; ('says' is usually {cusku}).  See also {krixa}, {cusku}, {casnu}, {tavla}, {voksa}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a banana/plantain [fruit/plant] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is sad/depressed/dejected/[unhappy/feels sorrow/grief] about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ runs on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$ with gait $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing $x_{2}$, held together by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of chalk from source $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bucket/pail/can/deep, solid, wide-topped container of contents $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bulb [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: rounded, bulgy].
$x_{1}$ is a balcony/overhang/ledge/shelf of building/structure $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a blade of tool/weapon $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in the future of/later than/after $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is latter; $x_{2}$ is former.
rows.n: Also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use {lidne} otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= {cfabalvi}); (default $x_2$ is the space time reference, whereupon:) $x_1$ will occur.  See also {lidne}, {cabna}, {purci}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in property/amount $x_{4}$ (ka/ni).
rows.n: On the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per {ragve}); also not limited to position in space.  See also {dukse}, {ragve}, {zmadu}, {kuspe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) defends/protects $x_{2}$ (object/state) from threat/peril/potential $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: Also secures (verb); $x_1$ wards/resists $x_3$; protective cover/shield (= {badgai}).  See also {ckape}, {fanta}, {fapro}, {marbi}, {rivbi}, {zunti}, {snura}, {binra}, {lunbe}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an amphibian of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}).  See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also rising, developing; $x_1$ gets bigger/enlarges/increases.  See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bank owned by/in banking system $x_{2}$ for banking function(s) $x_{3}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] (ka) forces/compels event $x_{2}$ to occur; $x_{1}$ determines property $x_{2}$ to manifest.
rows.n: Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}).  See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ arches/curves over/around $x_{2}$ and is made of $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an arch over/around $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also arc; $x_2$ need not be an object, but may be a point or volume.  See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tavern/bar/pub serving $x_{2}$ to audience/patrons $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: {ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks.  See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is on the outside of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is exterior to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to $x_{2}$ by (action) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.
$x_{1}$ bites/pinches $x_{2}$ on/at specific locus $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item $x_{2}$, with purpose $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a fool.
$x_{1}$ reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons $x_{2}$ directed/led by $x_{3}$ organized for purpose $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ is a mass; $x_2$ is a set completely specified); Also orchestra (= {zgibe'e}, {balzgibe'e}), outfit; $x_3$ conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= {cajbe'e}, {venbe'e}).  See also {gunma}, {girzu}, {dansu}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {kagni}, {kamni}, {minde}, {ralju}, {cecmu}, {gidva}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ transfers/sends/transmits $x_{2}$ to receiver $x_{3}$ from transmitter/origin $x_{4}$ via means/medium $x_{5}$.
rows.n: [also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied]; [$x_5$ carrier]; (cf. {muvdu}, {dunda}, {mrilu}, {nirna}, {xruti}, {cradi}, {tivni}, {preja}, cmavo list {be'i}, {bevri}, {mrilu}, {tcana}).

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a son of mother/father/parents $x_{2}$ [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brain [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: intelligence, mental control].
$x_{1}$ is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: midsection].
rows.n: Also stomach (= {djaruntyrango}), digestive tract (= {befctirango}, {befctirangyci'e}).  See also {cutne}, {livga}, {canti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a spherical object [made of $x_{2}$].
$x_{1}$ is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function $x_{2}$ in body of $x_{3}$; [metaphor: calcium].
rows.n: $x_2$ is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le <body-part>); cartilage/gristle (= {ranbo'u}), skeleton (= {bogygreku}).  See also {greku}, {denci}, {jirna}, {sarji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$ with lid $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium $x_{2}$, wave-form $x_{3}$, wave-length $x_{4}$, frequency $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of $x_{2}$ in struggle $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: This is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi.  See also {carvi}, {snime}, {bisli}, {tcima}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is ready/prepared for $x_{2}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fish of species $x_{2}$ [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates].
$x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].
$x_{1}$ is a current/flow/river of/in $x_{2}$ flowing in direction to/towards $x_{3}$ from direction/source $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$; $x_2$ is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); $x_1$ flushes toward $x_3$; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ fails at doing $x_{2}$ (state/event); $x_{1}$ is a failure at its role in $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Baffled (= {pesfli}, {jmifli}, {dafspufli}, {menfli}, among other senses); also $x_2$ ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of $x_1$.  See also {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the face [head/body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is facial.
$x_{1}$ is a field [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a broad uniform expanse of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also woods (= {ricfoi}), lawn/meadow (= {sasfoi}), brush (= {spafoi}, {cicyspafoi}).  See also {purdi}, {cange}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material $x_{2}$, with bubbles/vacuoles of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose $x_{2}$ with tines/prongs $x_{3}$ on base/support $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reacts/responds/answers with action $x_{2}$ to stimulus $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is responsive.
rows.n: $x_3$ stimulates $x_1$ into reaction $x_2$, $x_3$ stimulates reaction $x_2$ (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}).  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ forgives $x_{2}$ for event/state/activity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also other-than (less common meaning).  See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (action) is easy/simple/facile for $x_{2}$ (agent) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ does $x_{1}$ freely/easily.
$x_{1}$ is a fraction, with numerator $x_{2}$, denominator $x_{3}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$).
$x_{1}$ offers/proffers $x_{2}$ [offering] to $x_{3}$ with conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_4$ may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, {posyselfriti} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ frowns/grimaces (facial expression).
rows.n: $x_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $x_2$ (= {frufra}).  See also {cmila}, {cisma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).
rows.n: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus $x_{2}$ (object/nu) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring $x_{2}$ (event/state) within system/community $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Regulation, prescription (also $x_2$), principle, requirement (also $x_2$), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within $x_2$); $x_1$ is regulatory; $x_2$, $x_3$ are regulated.  See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$.  See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
rows.n: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
$x_{1}$ is near/close to/approximates $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Working for another (= {selplijibri}).  See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is at the bottom of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= {selcmu} for reordered places); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects).  See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
rows.n: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
rows.n: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
rows.n: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
rows.n: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
rows.n: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
rows.n: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
rows.n: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].
$x_{1}$ is a thousand [1000; $10^3$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is sharp/keen at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Pakistani/Pashto culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a street/avenue/lane/drive/cul-de-sac/way/alley/[road] at $x_{2}$ accessing $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also corridor; not typically a route between points, but offers access to sites along it.  See also {naxle}, {panka}, {pluta}, {dargu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ weeps/cries tears $x_{2}$ about/for reason $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ comes/goes to destination $x_{2}$ from origin $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ using means/vehicle $x_{5}$.
rows.n: Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; $x_1$ is a traveller; ($x_4$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is measured by $x_2$ (number) on scale $x_3$ (si'o, property of $x_1$ with kau).
rows.n: Also count. To specify the number of objects, {loi} is usually used in x1 of klani. To specify size, fill x3 of klani. See also cmavo list {la'u}, {namcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum.  See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
rows.n: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
rows.n: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
rows.n: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
rows.n: "without evidence" refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
rows.n: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
rows.n: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also touching, contiguous, against.  See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
rows.n: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is cold/cool by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is late by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
rows.n: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
rows.n: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
rows.n: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ mingles/mixes/blends into $x_1$; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component/element of $x_1$ (= {selxre} for reordered places).  See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is to the side of/lateral to $x_{2}$ and facing $x_{3}$ from point of view/in-frame-of-reference $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (cf. {crane}, {trixe}, {pritu}, {zunle} which differ in that the direction of facing is the front and not the lateral side.  The $x_4$ of mlana may be either the front, or back side of $x_2$, {korbi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is feline.
$x_{1}$ is less than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also negative (= {nonme'a}).  See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mold/fungus/mushrooms/truffles of species/strain $x_{2}$ parasitic/growing on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a satellite/moon orbiting $x_{2}$ with characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ [tool] is a hammer for/hammers $x_{2}$ [target] consisting of weight/head $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is immaterial/not physical/without material form.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains wood/lumber from tree(s) of type/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (action/event/state) motivates/is a motive/incentive for action/event $x_{2}$, per volition of $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also; $x_3$ is motivated to bring about result/goal/objective $x_2$ by $x_1$ (= {termu'i} for reordered places); (note that 'under conditions' BAI may apply and be appropriately added to the main predicate level or within the $x_2$ action level).  (cf. cmavo list {mu'i}, {nibli}, te {zukte} - generally better for 'goal', se {jalge}, {krinu}, {rinka}, {ciksi}, {djica}, {xlura})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) is complete/done/finished; $x_{1}$ (object) has become whole in property $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also perfected, entirety; (adverb/adjective:) entire, total, integral, fully, totally, wholly, completely, entirely.  See also {fanmo}, {culno}, {pagbu}, {xadba}, {prane}, {jalge}, {sumji}, {munje}, {sisti}, {xadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a universe/cosmos [complete and ordered entirety] of domain/sphere $x_{2}$ defined by rules $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also world; a universe is a kind of system, one which comprehensively encompasses its domain; e.g. 'universe of discourse', or 'world of birds'; $x_3$ are the rules/defining principles which distinguish the universe from other universes, or from non-universe.  See also {ciste}, {plini}, {kensa}, {mulno}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is prose about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject.  See also {cfika}, {lisri}, {cukta}, {pemci}, {finti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a process with inputs $x_{2}$, outputs/results $x_{3}$, passing through steps/stages $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ resource (= {selru'e}, but also {ru'etci}, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla).  See also cmavo list {pu'e}, {farvi}, {tadji}, {grute}, {tcini}.

rows.d: (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is elastic/springy.
$x_{1}$ is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; $x_{1}$ is ghostly/ethereal.
$x_{1}$ is sound produced/emitted by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ sings/chants $x_{2}$ [song/hymn/melody/melodic sounds] to audience $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Melody (= {sagzgi}, {ralsagzgi}), harmony (= {saxsagzgi}), harmonize/sing harmony (= {saxsa'a}), song (= {selsa'a}).  See also {pemci}, {rimni}, {rilti}, {siclu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is conscious/aware of $x_{2}$ (object/abstract); $x_{1}$ discerns/recognizes $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ knows Of. $x_2$ (one sense); awareness implies some amount of mental processing above and beyond mere sensory detection, and may also be applied to mental relationships that are not detected by the senses]; See also {menli}, {morji}, {ganse}, {sipna}, {cikna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ stands [is vertically oriented] on surface $x_{2}$ supported by limbs/support/pedestal $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is standing; $x_1$ stands up; $x_1$ is erect/vertical/upright; $x_1$ bows/bends over (= {krosa'i}, {krosa'ibi'o}, {plosa'i}); frame of reference is (approximate) perpendicularity to the surface, and not to a gravity field.  See also {kamju}, {sraji}, {tuple}, {zbepi}, {sarji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (mass) is a meal composed of dishes including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is a course/dish of meal $x_1$ (= {selsai} for reordered places).  See also {barja}, {stasu}, {gusta}, {sanso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a sauce/topping/gravy/frosting for use with $x_{2}$, containing ingredient(s) including $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component of sauce $x_1$.  See also {sanmi}, {mixre}, {stasu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an umbrella/parasol shielding $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$, supported by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ (abstract) is necessary/required for continuing state/process $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also factually necessary, necessity, prerequisite, condition, precondition.  See also cmavo list {sau}, {nitcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ supports/holds up/is underpinning of/[helps] $x_{2}$ against force/opposition $x_{3}$ with/by means $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also aids; (adjective:) $x_1$ is dependable, reliable (such reliability may be transient; this is not the usual sense of 'reliable' or 'dependable'); ($x_2$ is object/event).  See also {bradi}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {sidju}, {tugni}, {bongu}, {ckana}, {cpana}, {loldi}, {sanli}, {selfu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a spiral/helix/whorl/[vortex] [shape/form] with limits $x_{2}$, of dimensionality $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is harmonious/concordant/in agreement/concord with $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (mass of facts) is science of/about subject matter $x_{2}$ based on methodology $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Not limited to science as derived by the scientific method, but pertaining to any body of usually-coherent knowledge garnered/gathered/assembled by a consistent methodology.  See also {datni}, {fatci}, {djuno}, {cipra}, {pensi}, {jimpe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [measurement/match] is exact/precise to precision $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ (agent) strokes/rubs/pets $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a noise/din/clamor [sensory input without useful information] to $x_{2}$ via sensory channel $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an indivisible, most basic subunit of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ generally has mass nature); (cf. {kantu} for properties, activities; {ratni}, {gradu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Semitic [metaphor: Middle-Eastern] language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Semitic includes Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, and Ethiopian, among others.  See also {xrabo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ sneezes (intransitive verb).
$x_{1}$ doubts/is dubious/doubtful/skeptical/questions that $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true.
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is doubtful/dubious/questionable (= {selsenpi} for reordered places).  See also {jinvi}, {krici}, {djuno}, {birti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a layer/stratum [shape/form] of $x_{2}$ [material] within structure/continuum/composite $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ dreams about/that $x_{2}$ (fact/idea/event/state); $x_{2}$ is a dream/reverie of $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cigar/cigarette/cigarillo made from tobacco/smokable substance $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of silk produced by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a portion/quantity of salt from source $x_{2}$, of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ seems/appears to have property(ies) $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ seems like it has $x_2$ to $x_3$; suggest belief/observation (= {mlugau}, {mluti'i}); looks like/resembles (= {smimlu}, {mitmlu}).  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {simsa}, {zgana}, {ganse}, {jarco}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is similar/parallel to $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni); $x_{1}$ looks/appears like $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a likeness/image of $x_2$; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike; similarity and parallel differ primarily in emphasis.  See also {dunli}, {frica}, {mintu}, {panra}, {simlu}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally $x_{2}$ (event [$x_{1}$ should be reflexive in 1+ sumti]).
rows.n: Members of $x_1$ do to each other/one another $x_2$, and in return do $x_2$; $x_1$ (plural set) do the same thing $x_2$ to each other.  See also {kampu}, {mintu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a snake/serpent of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ esteems/respects/venerates/highly regards $x_{2}$ [object of respect].
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is respected/esteemed/celebrated (= {selsi'a} for reordered places).  See also {banli}, {censa}, {misno}, {nelci}, {prami}, {salci}, {jgira}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ signifies $x_2$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}).  See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is asleep (adjective); $x_{1}$ sleeps/is sleeping.
$x_{1}$ is straight/direct/line segment/interval between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$; (adjective:)  $x_{1}$ is linear.
$x_{1}$ reflects Syrian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ seeks/searches/looks for property $x_{2}$ among set $x_{3}$ (complete specification of set).
rows.n: If searching for an object or an event, use tu'a in $x_2$.  See also {cirko}, {kalte}, {kavbu}, {kucli}, {rivbi}, {manci}, {facki}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state $x_{2}$ [not necessarily completing it].
$x_{1}$ cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source $x_{2}$ for information/statement $x_{3}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ is private/personal/privy/[secret/confidential/confined] to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is not-public/hidden.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is secret (one sense); $x_2$ is in the know/in touch with/privy to $x_1$ (= {selsivni} for reordered places); exclusion can be expressed by na'e(bo) in $x_2$: excluded/in the dark (= {nalselsivni}).  See also {gubni}, {mipri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a skirt/kilt/dress of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is skirted [garment open at the bottom; not legged].
rows.n: A skirted garment may be full length ({pastu}), but must hang below the waist from support above or at the waist.  See also {taxfu}, {palku}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a computer for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pelt/skin/hide/leather from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is/appears to be of color/hue $x_{2}$ as perceived/seen by $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Conditions may include lighting, background, etc..  See also {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {cinta}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}, {carmi}, {kandi}, {xekri}, {blabi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ tells about/describes $x_{2}$ (object/event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with description $x_{4}$ (property).
$x_{1}$ is a ski/skid/skate/runner for surface (of material) $x_{2}$ supporting skier/skater/sled/cargo $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cinema/movie/film about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject/activity], filmmaker $x_{3}$, for audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also motion picture; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject; cartoon/animation (= selxraci'a {skina}); television/tv show (= {tivyskina}, regardless of length, factual content, etc.).  See also {tivni}, {vidni}, {pixra}, {finti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is cord/cable/rope/line/twine/cordage/woven strands of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Gaelic/Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Irish (= {sicko'o}), Scottish (= {sunko'o}), Celtic (= {dzeko'o}), Welsh (= {nanko'o}), Breton (= {fasko'o}); since Scottish/Gaelic is only the northern branch of the Celtic tribes, many would prefer a fu'ivla for Celtic; nationalism might also demand a separate fu'ivla for Irish.  See also {brito}, {glico}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a groove/trench/furrow [shape/form] in object/surface $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is old/familiar/well-known to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: This can cover both meanings of old.  Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through $x_2$ = the world, life, existence (= loi nu {zasti}); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis.  However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= {nalci'o}, {tolci'o}), but the opposite of 'new' (= {tolni'o}); also ancient (= {tcesau}), age (= {nilsau}); $x_2$ is used to $x_1$ (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= {cirsau}, {cirselcedra}; also {vaipru}).  (cf. {clani}, {citno}, {cnino}, se {djuno}; not the opposite of {citno}, {djuno})

rows.d:
attitudinal: 
{a'e} - alertness
{a'enai} - exhaustion.

attitudinal: 
{a'i} - effort
{a'icu'i} - no special effort
{a'inai} - repose.

attitudinal: 
{ai} - intent
{aicu'i} - indecision
{ainai} - rejection/refusal.

attitudinal: 
{a'o} - hope
{a'onai} - despair.
time tense relation/direction: will [selbri]; after [sumti]; default future tense.

{ba'a} - evidential: I expect
{ba'acu'i} - I experience
{ba'anai} - I remember.
forethought emphasis indicator; indicates next word is especially emphasized.
{basti} modal, 1st place                            replaced by ...
{bapli} modal, 1st place (forced by)                forcedly; compelled by force ...
interval event contour: in the aftermath of ...; since ...; retrospective/perfect              |     |----.

discursive: 
{ba'u} - exaggeration
{ba'ucu'i} - accuracy
{ba'unai} - understatement.
{bangu} modal, 1st place                            in language ...
sumti link to attach sumti (default $x_{2}$) to a selbri; used in descriptions.
location tense relation/direction; north of.
vocative: request to send/speak.
{benji} modal, 1st place (sender)                   sent by ...
separates multiple linked sumti within a selbri; used in descriptions.
elidable terminator: end linked sumti in specified description.

attitudinal modifier: 
{be'u} - lack/need
{be'ucu'i} - presence/satisfaction
{be'unai} - satiation.

discursive: 
{bi'u} - newly introduced information
{bi'unai} - previously introduced information.

vocative: 
{fi'i} - hospitality
{fi'inai} - inhospitality; you are welcome/ make yourself at home.
convert selbri to nonce modal/sumti tag.
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
sumti place tag: tag 4th sumti place.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #6 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #7 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #8 (specified by goi).
terminator: end composite lerfu; never elidable.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #9 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #10 (specified by goi).
sumti place tag: tag 5th sumti place.
reverse Polish mathematical expression (mex) operator flag.
begin indicator long scope.

attitudinal modifier: 
{fu'i} - easy
{fu'inai} - difficult.
end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
letteral for f.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
{zgana} modal, 1st place                            to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur;  used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].

attitudinal: 
{i'o} - appreciation
{i'onai} - envy.

attitudinal: 
{io} - respect
{ionai} - disrespect.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
{krati} modal, 1st place                            represented by ...
{ckaji} modal, 1st place                            characterizing ...
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
rows.n: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

rows.d: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.

discursive: 
{ke'u} - repeating
{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.

vocative: 
{ki'e} - thanks
{ki'enai} - no thanks to you.
{ckini} modal, 1st place (related to)               relatively; as a relation of ...
digit/number: number comma; thousands.
{krinu} modal, 1st place (justified by)             justifiably; because of reason ...
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...

attitudinal modifier: 
{le'o} - aggressive
{le'ocu'i} - passive
{le'onai} - defensive.
{manri} modal, 1st place (by standard 2)            in reference frame ...
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
{cmene} modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
digit/number: less than.
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

rows.d: the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.

{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction
{mi'enai} - denial of identity; identifies speaker.
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
discursive: ditto.
pro-bridi: bridi/selbri/brivla question.
digit/number: too few; subjective.
convert sumti to mex operand; sample use in story arithmetic: [3 apples] + [3 apples] = what.
mark motions in space-time.
convert number to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is (n)th member of set $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
digit/number: 5 (digit) [five].

discursive: 
{mu'a} - for example
{mu'acu'i} - omitting
{mu'anai} - end examples.
abstractor: achievement (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is the event-as-a-point/achievement of [bridi].
{mukti} modal, 1st place                            because of motive ...
time tense relation/direction: did [selbri]; before/prior to [sumti]; default past tense.
{pluka} modal, 1st place                            pleased by ...
{pruce} modal, 1st place (in manner 1)              by process ...
modal aspect: can and has; demonstrated potential.
evidential: I know by internal experience (dream, vision, or personal revelation).
convert number to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is an (n)th portion of mass/totality $x_{2}$; (cf. gunma).
trinary mathematical operator: [sigma summation of a using variable b over range c].
abstractor: idea/concept abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s concept of [bridi].
{sidju} modal, 1st place (aiding agent)             aided by ...
$x_1$ is characterized by $x_2$ (ka) emphasized by $x_3$
rows.n: Used for emphasizing a trait on x1. For example "He is a complete idiot" where "complete" is emphasizing, but not really modifying "idiot".

rows.d: $x_1$ is a bamboo (Bambuseae) of genus/species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an omnibus for carrying $x_2$ in medium $x_3$ propelled by $x_4$.
rows.n: Cf. {sorprekarce}; {pavloibasfa} for single-decker, {relyloibasfa} for double-decker {jonbasfa} for articulated, {clajonbasfa} for bi-articulated, {dizbasfa} for low-floor, {drucaubasfa} for open top, {kumbasfa} for coach, {dicybasfa} for trolleybus.

rows.d: $x_1$ will happen in $x_2$ length of time; $x_1$ will happen $x_2$ length of time after $x_3$
$x_1$ is the 'back', dorsum of body $x_2$
rows.n: Opposite of ventral part of the body. Not necessarily should be a posterior part of the body. Determined by bilateral symmetry of the body. See also {vente}, {trixe}, {cutne}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the "beneficiary"/intended-recipient of $x_2$ (event/action), as intended by $x_3$ // $x_2$ is done for $x_1$
rows.n: A "beneficiary" here is someone or something for which something is done, and this relation may be either beneficial or disadvantageous. Consider "I poisoned the cake for him" vs "I baked a cake for him" ("for him to eat" would be a purpose/goal). See also {be'ei}, {kosmu}, {terzu'e}, {selxau}

rows.d: $x_1$ dons metaphorical asbestos suit $x_2$ to guard against flames $x_3$ on topic $x_4$ from $x_5$, who disagrees with post $x_6$ for reason $x_7$, not realizing that the post was meant to be sent to $x_8$ rather than all of mailing list $x_9$ (default jboste) where it was posted in response to email  $x_{10}$, whose author wishes selma'o  $x_{11}$ (default SE) were extended to concisely express place  $x_{12}$ of brivla  $x_{13}$ (default besto) which has place structure  $x_{14}$ and too many places because of sadistic whim  $x_{15}$ of brivla-maker  $x_{16}$, who also created brivla  $x_{17}$ which has place structure  $x_{18}$, and so winds up using too many of cmavo  $x_{19}$ (default zi'o) in order to make the brivla ( $x_{13}$) more usable by standard  $x_{20}$ and wishes they had never heard of the word besto for reason  $x_{21}$, not realizing for reason  $x_{22}$ that it was suggested sarcastically due to boredom  $x_{23}$ of person  $x_{24}$, who is proposing it against better judgement  $x_{25}$ because it is fun by standard  $x_{26}$, but still wishes it had as many places as  $x_{27}$ (default du) for reason  $x_{28}$, and feels like throwing in epistemology sumti  $x_{29}$, because he/she knows both that gismu  $x_{30}$ (default besto) has its place structure defined by run-on sentence  $x_{31}$ and that epistemology sumti are used in gismu  $x_{32}$ by epistemology  $x_{33}$, notwithstanding the fact that  $x_{34}$ actually has a use for besto places  $x_{35}$ (default 1) through  $x_{36}$ (default $x_7$) and wishes this weren't an extremely long and stupid joke, longer than joke  $x_{37}$ and stupider than joke  $x_{38}$ but still appreciated by  $x_{39}$ - a fact which says  $x_{40}$ about them in the opinion of  $x_{41}$ - but not seen as even remotely amusing by  $x_{42}$, who is aware that  $x_{43}$ has a use for the gismu besto because of  $x_{45}$
rows.n: A joke gismu from http://mw.lojban.org/papri/besto . Place $x_{44}$ is absent for some reason.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a forest of components $x_2$
$x_1$ is acclaimed/praised for achievement $x_2$ by $x_3$ via noise/gesture/method of praise  $x_4$
rows.n: Not just vocal cheering. See also: ".{ui'o}".

rows.d: $x_1$ is excited/feels excitement about $x_2$ (event/property); $x_2$ excites $x_1$

$x_1$ awaits for $x_2$ (event) with bated breath; $x_1$ waits for the occurrence of $x_2$ excitedly/restlessly; colloquially: $x_1$ just cannot wait for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ is eager for event $x_2$.
rows.n: The colloquial definition is figurative: the waiting must and will be performed, but $x_1$ wants $x_2$ to happen as soon as possible/to just come already- for time to flow faster. This is how a child feels on Christmas Eve night for Christmas Day. Usually positive; the negative version is essentially "dread". There should be a sense of longing (but future-oriented), intensity, and/or aching for what $x_1$ vaguely expects to happen (independent of what actually does end up happening). See also: {fizbu} (which lacks the sense of waiting), {denpa} (which lacks the sense of excitement and which has too many terbri). Proposed rafsi: "-fiz-".

rows.d: $x_1$ is (a) philosophy/ideology (one sense) about/of/pertaining to topic/subfield (one sense) $x_2$ with subfield (different sense)/features/details/specifics/specific idea(s) $x_3$, with methodology $x_4$, followed/thought/considered by $x_5$ (thinker/philosopher/individual); philosophy $x_1$ is characterized by values/thoughts/opinions/ruminations $x_3$ about topic/subject $x_2$.
rows.n: May also include code of conduct, ethical protocol, mode of thought, life-musings, etc.. x5 need not be an ardent supporter of the philosophy, although a certain degree of substance might be implied by the connection of being a philosophy (rather than a passing thought or idea) thereof; x5 does not need to be professional. Proposed short rafsi: -les-. See also: {pijyske}, {filsofiia}, {filsofo}, {marde}, {lijda}, {saske}, {jinvi}, {sidbo}, {pensi}, {prije}, {djuno}, {krici}, {menli}, {jijnu}, {senpi}, {birti}.

rows.d: $x_1$ reflects Filipino culture/nationality/language/geography in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.
$x_1$ is a galaxy, of contents $x_2$ and other characteristics/parameters $x_3$; $x_1$ is galactic.
$x_1$ is turned off / deactivated, not performing function $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects jbobau language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_2$
rows.n: Alternative to {lojbo} based on the observation that the word "Lojban" has effectively become an exonym, as the majority of speakers now refer to Lojban as "lo/le/la jbobau" in the language itself. Especially used by speakers of nonstandard varieties of Lojban to distinguish dialects from the official standard of "CLL" Lojban.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a monster of species/variety $x_2$
*$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
rows.n: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
rows.n: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
rows.n: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

rows.d: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
rows.n: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.

rows.d: $x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
rows.n: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

rows.d: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
rows.n: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

rows.d: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
rows.n: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
rows.n: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a binary relationship which is symmetric (under exchange of arguments/terms) in space/under conditions/on set $x_2$.
rows.n: Denote this binary relation $x_1$ between elements y, z (in that order) by "y R z" (in that order); then, for any elements a, b in the set of consideration (possibly $x_2$), if a R b, then b R a. See also: {kinra}, {takni}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a binary relationship which is reflexive in space/under conditions/on set $x_2$.
rows.n: Denote this binary relation $x_1$ between elements y, z (in that order) by "y R z" (in that order); then, for any element 'a' in the set of consideration (possibly $x_2$), a R a. "Reflexive property" = "ka(m)( )kinra". See also: {takni}, {kinfi}.

rows.d: $x1$ keeps/raises $x2$ [animals] in sty/stall/stale/pen $x3$ for purpose $x4$
$x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
rows.n: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

rows.d: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.
rows.n: A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".

rows.d: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.
rows.n: See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.

rows.d: $x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$
rows.n: Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}

rows.d: $x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
rows.n: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$
rows.n: Phonologically inspired from 'core', 'heart', and 心 (romaji: kokoro).

rows.d: $x_1$ is old/aged [relatively long in elapsed duration] by standard $x_2$
$x_1$ is a lamp/candle/torch with fuel/power source $x_2$
rows.n: Refers to any artificial light source, whether flammable or electric. For "electric lamp," see {diclamdu}. See also {lanru}, {gusni}, {livla}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the ISO-named country (or subdivision thereof) of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$
$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
rows.n: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a lily [Lilium] of species/strain $x_2$
$x_1$ is a speakable language used by persons $x_2$
rows.n: A narrower term than {bangu}, is limited to speakable, usable in dialogues languages used by persons ({lo} {prenu}). Doesn't include languages with information transferred one-way (languages of road signs), doesn't include computer programming languages that are not speakable between two persons.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a microörganism, virus, protein, spore, pathogen, or other such substance which causes or is intimately associated with disease(s)/symptoms $x_2$.
$x_1$ is mauve [color]
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
rows.n: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of “mango”. {ricrmango} for “mango tree”.

rows.d: x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3
$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
rows.n: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a honey produced by $x_2$
$x_1$ is/are among the referent(s) of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
rows.n: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is localized public transport system for city/metropolitan region/locale/region $x_2$ using infrastructure/facilities/means of transportation $x_3$.
rows.n: This is mostly just to reserve the gismu space for "metro", which is begging to be made into a gismu; this may not be the best definition for the word space. Need not be a subway/underground train system.

rows.d: $x_1$ (li; number) is congruent to $x_2$ (li; number; see description for canonical/traditional/contextless default usage) modulo $x_3$ (li; number); $\frac{(x_1 - x_2)}{x_3}$ is an integer.
rows.n: In order to be clear (in case of poor display), ($x_1$ - $x_2$)/$x_3$ is an integer, possibly (but not necessarily) nonpositive. Traditionally, but not necessarily, $x_3$ is a strictly positive integer (in particular, $x_3$ is nonzero) and is called "(the) modulus"; if $x_3 = 1$, then $x_1$ and $x_2$ differ only by an integer amount - in other words, they have the same fractional part. Technically, $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric under mutual exchange and can even be equivalent; however, in a manner morally analogous to "{srana}", $x_2$ is canonically/traditionally either the common residue (the unique element in the space which is congruent to $x_1$ mod $x_3$ and which is greater than or equal to 0 and strictly less than $x_3$) or the minimal residue (denoting the common residue by $c$, the minimal residue is either $c$ xor $c - x_3$, whichever is strictly less than the other in absolute value), and this may even be considered as its contextless default meaning (such as in "lo se modju"). See also: {dilcu}, {dunli}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {panra}, {dilma} (a particularly close relative and generalization of this word with slightly different focus).
